availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Philip Tomppert, Jr. (Clerk of the Louisville City Court.)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, city court clerk. Kentucky native. Son of Philip Tomppert and Margaret Tomppert. Married to Henrietta Reuning Tomppert in Louisville on December 3, 1861. Father of Louis P. Tomppert and Eugenia E. Tomppert. Student in Louisville in 1850. Clerk of the Louisville City Court in 1865. Clerk of the Louisville City Court in 1870.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville District 1, p. 19B
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, County, City/District, p. X
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, 1st ward, p. 104.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, X County Marriages, Film #000482709, p. 82 (p. 190 of microfilm).
“Philip Tomppert Dead,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), December 23, 1895, p. 8.
Find A Grave, "J. Phillip Tomppert, Jr (1839-1895)," Memorial #155379750, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/155379750(accessed October 25, 2019).
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport – Microfilm (before 1911), KDLA, Roll #Film 7019171, All County Deaths, p. 2989 of microfilm.
